docs.lead_paragraph: According to two economists at Colorado State, preseason performance stopped being an indicator around 1994, a year after the 1993 collective bargaining agreement.

headline.seo: N.F.L. Preseason No Longer Forecasts Regular Season, Study Finds
headline.main: Preseason Games No Longer Forecast Regular Season, a Study Finds
headline.print_headline: Preseason Games No Longer Forecast Regular Season, a Study Finds

docs.snippet: According to two economists at Colorado State, preseason performance stopped being an indicator around 1994, a year after the 1993 collective bargaining agreement.

docs.lead_paragraph: Applying for government benefits was exactly a way of taking responsibility for myself and my son during a difficult time in our lives.
docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by author Larkin Warren describes her own reliance on government benefits, including welfare, which helped her turn around her life; disputes Mitt Romney's assertion that those who utilize government benefits cannot take personal responsibility for their lives.
docs.snippet: Applying for government benefits was exactly a way of taking responsibility for myself and my son during a difficult time in our lives.

docs.abstract: And you can see it in the numbers.
docs.snippet: And you can see it in the numbers.

docs.lead_paragraph: The move to electronic health records may be adding billions of dollars to Medicare costs by enabling hospitals and physicians to bill more for the same services.

headline.seo: Medicare Billing Rises at Hospitals With Electronic Records
headline.main: Medicare Bills Rise as Records Turn Electronic
headline.print_headline: Medicare Bills Rise as Records Turn Electronic

docs.abstract: Transition to electronic health records nationwide may be contributing to billions of dollars in higher costs for Medicare, private insurers and patients by making it easier for hospitals and physicians to bill more for their services, whether or not they provide additional care; government has provided huge incentives to push for the change, believing that it would both improve care and reduce overall costs.
docs.snippet: The move to electronic health records may be adding billions of dollars to Medicare costs by enabling hospitals and physicians to bill more for the same services.

byline.original: By REED ABELSON, JULIE CRESWELL and GRIFF PALMER

docs.lead_paragraph: President Obama and Representative Paul D. Ryan each accused the other of posing a threat to the future of the Medicare program, with Mr. Obama getting a better reception.

headline.seo: Obama and Ryan Discuss Medicare at AARP Convention
headline.main: Obama and Ryan Trade Blasts Over Medicare at AARP Convention
headline.print_headline: Obama and Ryan Trade Blasts Over Medicare at AARP Convention

docs.abstract: Pres Obama trades charges with Rep Paul D Ryan over the financing of Medicare in back-to-back appearances at an AARP convention in Virginia; each candidate appeals to older voters with warnings that his opponent will threaten the future of the federal health program.
docs.snippet: President Obama and Representative Paul D. Ryan each accused the other of posing a threat to the future of the Medicare program, with Mr. Obama getting a better reception.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

byline.contributor: Mark Landler reported from Woodbridge, and Richard A. Oppel Jr.  from New Orleans.
byline.original: By MARK LANDLER and RICHARD A. OPPEL Jr

docs.lead_paragraph: Some parents help their adult children financially, while others cannot or do not — and that often unspoken distinction among families can determine who gets ahead.
docs.abstract: Ron Lieber Your Money column contends that 'living inheritance,' the financial assistance provided by parents to their children throughout their lives, is a strong determining factor in who gets ahead and who does not.
docs.snippet: Some parents help their adult children financially, while others cannot or do not — and that often unspoken distinction among families can determine who gets ahead.
